title: Bug 108822 - Improve logic for disk sorting with border values for row value
OB: When sorting on disk, if sorting 40000 rows of data and the program is configured to process less than 40000 rows, the program performs the following steps: 1.
SR: When sorting on disk, if there are 40000 rows of data and the program is configured to process less than 40000 rows, the expected behavior should be: 1. Save the data to a temporary file. 2. Load the data from the temporary file into memory. 3. Perform the sorting on the data. 4. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file.
